CHAPTER 1

When [I]0-i was four , [[my]0-i father]373-churchill died in an oil - rig accident . [Daddy]116-daddy did n't even work for the drilling outfit . [He]373-churchill was [a company man who wore a suit and tie when [he]373-churchill went to inspect [the production and drilling platforms]375-the production and drilling platforms . But one day [he]373-churchill stumbled on an opening in the rig floor before setup was completed]374-a company man who wore a suit and tie when he went to inspect the production and drilling platforms . but one day he stumbled on an opening in the rig floor before setup was completed . [He]373-churchill fell sixty feet to [the platform below]376-the platform below and died instantly , [his]373-churchill neck broken .

It took [me]0-i a long time to understand [Daddy]116-daddy was never coming back . [I]0-i waited for [him]373-churchill for months , sitting at the front window of [[our]377-our house in [Katy]1-katy , just west of [Houston]2907-houston]378-our house in katy , just west of houston . Some days [I]0-i stood at the end of [the driveway]379-the driveway to watch [every car]380-every car that passed . No matter how often [Mama]2932-mama told [me]0-i to quit looking for [him]373-churchill , [I]0-i could n't give up . [I]0-i guess [I]0-i thought the strength of [my]0-i wanting would be enough to make [him]373-churchill appear .

[I]0-i have only a handful of memories of [[my]0-i father]373-churchill , more like impressions . [He]373-churchill must have carried [me]0-i on [his]373-churchill shoulders a time or two — [I]0-i remember the hard plane of [his]373-churchill chest beneath [my]0-i calves , the sensation of swaying high in the air . anchored by the strong pressure of [his]373-churchill fingers around [my]0-i ankles . And the coarse drifts of [his]373-churchill hair in [my]0-i hands , shiny black hair cut in layers . [I]0-i can almost hear [his]373-churchill voice singing " [Arriba del Cielo]118-arriba del cielo , "[373-churchill] a Mexican lullaby that always gave [me]0-i sweet dreams .

There is a framed photograph of [Daddy]116-daddy on [my]0-i dresser , the only one [I]0-i have . [He]373-churchill 's wearing a Western dress shirt and jeans with creases pressed down the front , and a tooled leather belt with a silver and turquoise buckle the size of a breakfast plate . A little smile lingers in one corner of [his]373-churchill mouth , and a dimple punctuates the smoothness of [his]373-churchill swarthy cheek . By all accounts [he]373-churchill was [a smart man]382-a smart man , a romantic , [a hard worker with high - carat ambitions]382-a smart man . [I]0-i believe [he]373-churchill would have accomplished great things in [his]373-churchill life if [he]373-churchill 'd been given the gift of more years . [I]0-i know so little about [[my]0-i father]373-churchill , but [I]0-i 'm certain [he]373-churchill loved [me]0-i . [I]0-i can feel it even in those little wisps of memory .

[Mama]2932-mama never found [another man]384-another man to replace [Daddy]116-daddy . Or maybe it 's more accurate to say [she]2932-mama found a lot of [men]385-men to replace [him]384-another man . But hardly [any of [them]385-men]386-any of them stayed around for long . [She]2932-mama was [a beautiful woman]2932-mama , if not [a happy one]387-a happy one , and attracting [a man]388-a man was never a problem . Keeping one , however , was a different matter . By the time [I]0-i was thirteen , [Mama]2932-mama had gone through [more boyfriends]389-more boyfriends than [I]0-i could keep track of . It was sort of a relief when [she]2932-mama found one [she]2932-mama decided [she]2932-mama could stick with for a while .

[They]390-they agreed [they]390-they would move in together , in [the east [Texas town of Welcome]3-texas town of welcome]391-the east texas town of welcome , not far from where [he]3-texas town of welcome 'd grown up . As it turned out , Welcome was where [I]0-i lost everything , and gained everything . Welcome was the place where [my]0-i life was guided from one track to another , sending [me]0-i to places [I]0-i 'd never thought of going .

On [my]0-i first day at [the trailer park]392-the trailer park , [I]0-i wandered along [a dead - end road that cut between rows of trailers lined up like piano keys]393-a dead - end road that cut between rows of trailers lined up like piano keys . [The park]392-the trailer park was a dusty grid of [dead - end streets]394-dead - end streets , with a newly built loop that circled around the left side . [Each home]395-each home sat on its own concrete pad , dressed in a skirt made of aluminum or wooden latticework . A few trailers were fronted by patches of [yard]396-yard , some featuring crape myrtle with blossoms crisped a pale brown and the bark shredded from the heat .

The late afternoon sun was as round and white as a paper plate tacked to the sky . Heat seemed to come equally from below as above , uncurling in visible waves from the cracked ground . Time moved at a crawl in Welcome , where [people]397-people considered anything needing to be done in a hurry was n't worth doing . Dogs and cats spent most of the day sleeping in the hot shade , rousing only to lap a few tepid drops from the water hookups . Even the flies were slow .

An envelope containing a check crackled in the pocket of [my]0-i denim cutoffs . [Mama]2932-mama had told [me]0-i to take it to [the manager of [Bluebonnet Ranch]18-bluebonnet ranch]398-the manager of bluebonnet ranch , [Mr. Louis Sadlek]119-louis . who lived at [the redbrick house near the entrance of [the trailer park]392-the trailer park]399-the redbrick house near the entrance of the trailer park .

[My]0-i feet felt like [they]400-they 'd been steamed inside [my]0-i shoes as [I]0-i shuffled along the broken edges of asphalt . [I]0-i saw [a pair of older boys standing with [a teenage girl]402-the girl]401-the boys , [their]401-the boys postures relaxed and loose - limbed . [The girl]402-the girl had a long blond ponytail with a ball of hair - sprayed bangs in the front . [Her]402-the girl deep tan was exposed by short shorts and a tiny purple bikini top , which explained why [the boys]401-the boys were so absorbed in conversation with [her]402-the girl .

[One of [the boys]401-the boys]403-one of the boys was dressed in shorts and a tank top , while the other , dark - haired one wore a weathered pair of Wranglers and dirt - caked Roper boots . [He]403-one of the boys stood with [his]403-one of the boys weight shifted to one leg , one thumb hooked in a denim pocket , [his]403-one of the boys free hand gesturing as [he]403-one of the boys talked . There was something striking about [his]403-one of the boys slim , rawboned form , the hard edge of [his]403-one of the boys profile . [His]403-one of the boys vitality was almost jarring in those heat - drowsed surroundings .

Although Texans of all ages are naturally sociable and call out to [strangers]404-strangers without hesitation , it was obvious [I]0-i was going to walk by [this trio]405-this trio unnoticed . That was just fine with [me]0-i .

But as [I]0-i walked quietly along the other side of [the lane]406-the lane , [I]0-i was startled by an explosion of noise and movement . Rearing back , [I]0-i was set upon by what appeared to be a pair of rabid pit bulls . [They]401-the boys barked and snarled and peeled [their]401-the boys lips back to reveal jagged yellow teeth . [I]0-i had never been scared of dogs , but [these two]401-the boys were obviously out for the kill .

[My]0-i instincts took over , and [I]0-i spun to escape . The bald soles of [my]0-i old sneakers slipped on a scattering of pebbles , [my]0-i feet went out from under [me]0-i , and [I]0-i hit the ground on [my]0-i hands and knees . [I]0-i let out a scream and covered [my]0-i head with [my]0-i arms , fully expecting to be torn to pieces . But there was the sound of an angry voice over the blood rush in [my]0-i ears , and instead of teeth closing over [my]0-i flesh , [I]0-i felt a pair of strong hands take hold of [me]0-i .

[I]0-i yelped as [I]0-i was turned over to look up into the face of [the dark - haired boy]407-the boy . [He]407-the boy gave [me]0-i a swift assessing glance and turned to yell some more at the pit bulls . The dogs had retreated a few yards , their barking fading to peevish snarls .

" Go on , damn it , "[407-the boy] [the boy]407-the boy snapped at [them]408-them . " Get [your]407-the boy hindquarters back [home]2899-home and stop [scaring people]2900-scaring people , [[you]407-the boy sorry pair of sh]2901-you sorry pair of sh — "[407-the boy] [He]407-the boy checked [himself]407-the boy and darted a quick glance at [me]0-i .

[The pit bulls]409-the pit bulls quieted and slunk backward in a startling change of mood , pink tongues dangling like the half - curled ribbons of party balloons .

[[My]0-i rescuer]410-my rescuer viewed [them]409-the pit bulls with disgust and spoke to [the boy]407-the boy in the tank top . " [Pete]120-pete , take the dogs back to [Miss Marva]121-miss marva 's . "[409-the pit bulls]

" [They]409-the pit bulls 'll git [home]2899-home by theirselves . "[407-the boy] [the boy]407-the boy protested , reluctant to part company with [the blond girl in the bikini top]411-the blond girl in the bikini top .

" Take ['em]2903-'em back , "[407-the boy] came the authoritative reply , " and tell [Marva]121-miss marva to stop leaving the damn gate open . "[407-the boy]

While this conversation was taking place . [I]0-i glanced down at [my]0-i knees and saw [they]409-the pit bulls were oozing and peppered with gravel dust . [My]0-i descent into the pit of soul - shriveling embarrassment was complete as the shock wore off and [I]0-i started to cry . The harder [I]0-i gulped against the tightness of [my]0-i throat , the worse it became . Tears runneled from beneath [my]0-i big plastic - framed glasses .

" For [God]122-god 's sake ... "[407-the boy] [I]0-i heard [the boy in the tank top]407-the boy mutter . Heaving a sigh , [he]407-the boy went to the dogs and grabbed [them]409-the pit bulls by the collars . " Come on , [troublemakers]2904-troublemakers . "[407-the boy] [They]409-the pit bulls went with [him]407-the boy willingly , trotting smartly on either side as if [they]409-the pit bulls were auditioning for the 4H state dog show .

[The dark - haired boy]407-the boy 's attention returned to [me]0-i . and [his]407-the boy voice gentled . " Here , now ... [you're]407-the boy okay . No need to cry , honey . "[407-the boy] [He]407-the boy plucked a red handkerchief from [his]407-the boy back pocket and began to mop at [my]0-i face . Deftly [he]407-the boy wiped [my]0-i eyes and nose and told [me]0-i to blow . The handkerchief held the sharp bite of male sweat as it clamped firmly over [my]0-i nose . Back then [men of every age]412-men of every age had a red handkerchief tucked in the back pocket of [their]412-men of every age jeans . [I]0-i 'd seen kerchiefs used as a sieve , a coffee filter , a dust mask , and once as [a makeshift baby diaper]413-a makeshift baby diaper .

" Do n't ever run from dogs like that . "[407-the boy] [The boy]407-the boy tucked the kerchief in [his]407-the boy back pocket . " No matter how scared [you]407-the boy are . [You]407-the boy just look to the side and walk away real slow , understand ? And shout ' No ' in a loud voice like [you]407-the boy mean it . "[407-the boy]

[I]0-i sniffled and nodded , staring into [his]407-the boy shadowed face . [His]407-the boy wide mouth held the curve of a smile that sent a quiver down to the pit of [my]0-i stomach and knotted [my]0-i toes inside [my]0-i sneakers .

True handsomeness had escaped [him]407-the boy by millimeters . [His]407-the boy features were too blunt and bold , and [his]407-the boy nose had a crook near the bridge from having been broken once . But [he]407-the boy had a slow burn of a smile , and blue - on - blue eyes that seemed even brighter against the sun - glazed color of [his]407-the boy skin , and a tumble of dark brown hair as shiny as mink fur .

[I]0-i thought of the strength in [his]3004-hardy hands as [he]3004-hardy had picked [me]0-i up from the ground . [I]0-i watched [him]3004-hardy until [he]3004-hardy had disappeared from sight , and [my]0-i throat felt thick and tingly like [I]0-i 'd just swallowed a spoonful of warm honey .

The sunset finished with a long crack of light rimming the horizon , as if the sky were a big door and [God]122-god was taking one last peek . Good night , Welcome , [I]0-i thought , and went into [the trailer]429-the trailer .

CHAPTER 2

[[My]0-i new home]469-my new home smelled agreeably of fresh - molded plastic and new carpeting . It was a two - bedroom single - wide with a concrete patio pad in the back . [I]0-i 'd been allowed to pick out the wallpaper in [[my]0-i room]2906-my room , white with bunches of pink roses and a narrow blue ribbon woven throughout . [We]471-we had never lived in [a trailer]429-the trailer before , having occupied [a rent house in [Houston]2907-houston]472-a rent house in houston before [we]471-we moved east to [Welcome]8-welcome .

Like [the trailer]429-the trailer , [[Mama]2932-mama 's boyfriend]473-mama 's boyfriend , [Flip]131-flip , was a new acquisition . [He]131-flip 'd gotten [his]131-flip name from [his]131-flip habit of constantly flipping through TV channels , which had n't been so bad at first but after a while it drove [me]0-i crazy . When [Flip]131-flip was around , [no one]474-no one could watch more than five minutes of any one show .

[I]0-i was never sure why [Mama]2932-mama invited [him]131-flip to live with [us]471-we — [he]131-flip seemed no better or different than any of [[her]2932-mama other boyfriends]475-her other boyfriends . [Flip]131-flip was like a friendly , oversized dog . good - looking and lazy , with the hint of a beer belly , a shaggy mullet , and an easy grin .

[Mama]2932-mama had to support [him]131-flip financially from day one . with [her]2932-mama salary as [a receptionist at [the local title company]477-the local title company]476-a receptionist at the local title company . [Flip]131-flip , on the other hand , was perpetually unemployed . Although [Flip]131-flip had no objection to having a job , [he]131-flip was strongly opposed to the concept of actually looking for one . It was a common redneck paradox .

But [I]0-i liked [Flip]131-flip because [he]131-flip made [Mama]2932-mama laugh . The sound of those elusive laughs was so precious to [me]0-i , [I]0-i wished [I]0-i could capture one in a Mason jar and keep it forever .

[The trailer]429-the trailer smelled strongly of cigarettes and bluebonnet water , and something good baking in the oven . [Miss Marva]121-miss marva 's red velvet cake was the best [I]0-i had ever tasted , made with buttermilk and cocoa , and enough red food coloring to make it glow like a stoplight , the whole of it covered with an inch - thick layer of cream cheese frosting .

CHAPTER 3

[I]0-i spent most of the summer in [[Hannah]126-hannah 's company]566-hannah 's company , falling in with [her]126-hannah schemes and plans , which never amounted to anything but were enjoyable nonetheless . [We]567-we rode [[our]567-we bikes]568-our bikes into [town]2940-town , went out to explore [ravines and fields]570-ravines and fields and cave entrances , or sat together in [[Hannah]126-hannah 's room]571-hannah 's room listening to [Nirvana]145-nirvana . To [my]0-i disappointment [I]0-i seldom saw [Hardy]3004-hardy , who was always working . Or raising hell , as [[Hannah]126-hannah 's mother]572-hannah 's mother , [Miss Judie]146-miss judie , said sourly .

Wondering how much hell - raising could be done in [a town like Welcome]573-a town like welcome , [I]0-i culled as much information as [I]0-i could from [Hannah]126-hannah . It seemed to be a matter of general agreement that [Hardy Gates]3004-hardy was born for trouble , and sooner or later [he]3004-hardy would find it . So far [his]3004-hardy crimes had been minor ones , misdeeds and small acts of mischief that broadcast a frustrated voltage beneath [his]3004-hardy good - natured exterior . Breathlessly [Hannah]126-hannah related that [Hardy]3004-hardy had been seen with [girls]496-girls much older than [himself]3004-hardy , and there had even been rumors of a dalliance with [an older woman in [town]2940-town]575-an older woman in town .

" Has [he]3004-hardy ever been in love ? "[0-i] [I]0-i could n't resist asking , and [Hannah]126-hannah said no , according to [Hardy]3004-hardy falling in love was the last thing [he]3004-hardy needed . It would get in the way of [his]3004-hardy plans , which were to leave Welcome as soon as [Hannah]126-hannah and [[her]126-hannah brothers]577-her brothers were old enough to be of some help to [[their]577-her brothers mother]578-their mother , [Miss Judie]146-miss judie .

It was hard to understand how [a woman like [Miss Judie]146-miss judie]575-an older woman in town could have produced such an untamed brood . [She]146-miss judie was [a self - disciplined woman who seemed suspicious of pleasure in any form]575-an older woman in town . [Her]146-miss judie angular features were like one of those old - time prospector scales upon which were balanced equal amounts of meekness and brittle pride . [She]146-miss judie was [a tall , frail - looking woman whose wrists [you]579-you could snap like cottonwood twigs]146-miss judie . And [she]146-miss judie was living proof [you]579-you should never trust [a skinny cook]580-a skinny cook . [Her]146-miss judie notion of fixing dinner was to open cans and ferret out scraps in the vegetable drawer . No wilted carrot or petrified celery stalk was safe from [her]146-miss judie reach .

After one meal of leftover bologna mixed with canned green beans and served on warmed - over biscuits , and a dessert of canned frosting on toast , [I]0-i learned to take [my]0-i leave whenever [I]0-i heard the rattling of pans in [the kitchen]554-the kitchen . The strange thing was , [the Gates children]582-the gates children did n't seem to notice or care how terrible the food was . Every fluorescent curl of macaroni , every morsel of something suspended in [Jell - O]147-jell - o , every particle of fat and gristle disappeared from [their]582-the gates children plates within five minutes of being served .

On Saturdays [the Cateses]126-hannah went out to eat . but not at [the local Mexican restaurant]583-the local mexican restaurant or [the cafeteria]488-the cafeteria . [They]582-the gates children went to [[Earl]148-earl 's meat market]585-earl 's meat market , where [the butcher]586-the butcher dumped all the scraps and cuts [he]586-the butcher had n't been able to sell that day — sausages , tails , ribs , [innards]587-innards , pigs ' ears — into a big metal tub . " Everything but the oink , "[148-earl] [Earl]148-earl used to say with a grin . [He]148-earl was [a huge man with hands the size of catcher mitts and a face that glowed as red as fresh ham]148-earl .

After collecting the day 's leftovers , [Earl]148-earl would fill the tub with water and boil it all together . For twenty - five cents [you]588-you could pick out whatever [you]588-you wanted , and [Earl]148-earl would set it on a piece of butcher paper along with a slice of [Mrs. Baird]149-mrs. baird 's bread , and [you]588-you would eat at the linoleum table in the corner . Nothing was wasted at the meat market . After [people]397-people were through with the tub , [Earl]148-earl took what was left , ground it up . added bright yellow cornmeal , and sold it as dog food .

[The Cateses]126-hannah were dirt poor , but [they]397-people were never referred to as white trash . [Miss Judie]146-miss judie was [a respectable God - fearing woman , which elevated [the family]493-the family to the level of " poor white]146-miss judie . "[146-miss judie] It seems a minor distinction , but many doors in Welcome were open to [you]588-you if [you]588-you were poor white and closed if [you]588-you were white trash .

As [a file clerk]591-a file clerk to the only CPA in Welcome , [Miss Judie]146-miss judie earned barely enough to put a roof over [[her]146-miss judie children]592-her children 's heads , with [Hardy]3004-hardy 's income supplementing [her]146-miss judie meager earnings . When [I]0-i asked [Hannah]126-hannah where [[her]146-miss judie daddy]593-her daddy was , [she]146-miss judie told [me]0-i [he]593-her daddy was in the [Texarkana State Penitentiary]2907-houston , although [she]146-miss judie 'd never been able to find out what [he]593-her daddy 'd done to get [himself]593-her daddy [there]2907-houston .

Maybe [the family]493-the family 's troubled past was the reason [Miss Judie]146-miss judie had established a spotless record of church attendance . [She]146-miss judie went every Sunday morning and Wednesday night and was always to be found in the first three pews , where [the Lord]595-the lord 's presence was the strongest . Like [most people in Welcome]596-most people in welcome , [Miss Judie]146-miss judie drew conclusions about [a person based on [his]593-her daddy or [her]146-miss judie religion]597-a person based on his or her religion . "[146-miss judie] [she]146-miss judie pressed , until [I]0-i said [I]0-i thought [I]0-i was a lapsed Baptist .

This led to another tricky question . " Progressive Baptist or [Reformed Baptist]150-reformed baptist ? "[146-miss judie]

Since [I]0-i was n't sure of the difference , [I]0-i said [I]0-i thought [we]599-we were progressive . When [I]0-i told [Miss Marva]121-miss marva about the conversation later , and protested that " lapsed "[121-miss marva] meant [I]0-i did n't have to go to [church]598-church , [Miss Marva]121-miss marva replied there was no such thing as lapsed in Welcome , and [I]0-i might as well go with [her]121-miss marva and [[her]121-miss marva gentleman friend]604-her gentleman friend [Bobby Ray]151-bobby ray to the nondenominational Lamb of [God]122-god on [South Street]14-south street , because for all that [they]600-first baptist on main had [a guitarist]605-a guitarist instead of [an organist]606-an organist and held open communion , [they]600-first baptist on main also had the best potluck in [town]2940-town .

[Mama]2932-mama had no objection to [my]0-i attending church with [Miss Marva]121-miss marva and [Bobby Ray]151-bobby ray , although [she]121-miss marva said it suited [her]121-miss marva to remain lapsed for the time being . Having [no children]609-no children or grandchildren of [her]121-miss marva own , [Miss Marva]121-miss marva had decided to take [me]0-i under [her]121-miss marva wing . " Oh . [Miss Marva]121-miss marva , "[0-i] [I]0-i said with glee , throwing [my]0-i arms around [her]121-miss marva stalwart form , " [you]121-miss marva are the best ! Thank [you]121-miss marva a million times . A zillion times . "[0-i]

" It was nothing , "[121-miss marva] [she]121-miss marva said . " [I]121-miss marva ca n't take [a girl]2972-a girl in pants to [church]598-church , can [I]121-miss marva ? "[121-miss marva]

Naively [I]0-i thought when [I]0-i brought the dress [home]2899-home that [Mama]2932-mama would be pleased by the gift . [She]2932-mama trembled with anger and hollered until [I]0-i was in tears and [Flip]131-flip had left [the trailer]429-the trailer to go get more beer . [I]0-i cried [myself]0-i sick , thinking [I]0-i would n't be allowed to visit [Miss Marva]121-miss marva anymore , and wondering why [I]0-i had [the most selfish mother in [the world]417-the world whose pride meant more than [[her]121-miss marva own daughter]616-her own daughter 's spiritual welfare]614-the most selfish mother in the world whose pride meant more than her own daughter 's spiritual welfare . " Did [you]0-i ... did [you]0-i talk with [Miss Marva]121-miss marva ? "[0-i] [I]0-i ventured .

" Then [I]121-miss marva can go to [church]598-church with [her]121-miss marva ? "[121-miss marva]

"[121-miss marva]

" No . ma'am , "[0-i] [I]0-i agreed .

" No . [Your]2932-mama hair is beautiful . [Liberty]121-miss marva . "[2932-mama]

[I]0-i stood quietly against [her]2932-mama , willing the moment to last . [Her]2932-mama voice was a low , pleasant hum , [her]2932-mama chest rising and falling beneath [my]0-i ear . " [Baby]153-baby , [I]2932-mama know [you]153-baby do n't understand why [I]2932-mama was so mad about the dress . [I]0-i do n't think [anyone]2905-anyone could have predicted the emu .

[Emus]154-emus are n't native Texas birds , although from the number of [them]154-emus to be found , both wild and domestic , [you]649-you 'd have been excused for thinking otherwise . In fact , [Texas]15-texas is still known as [the emu capital of [the world]417-the world]15-texas . It started around ' 87 when [some fanners]651-some fanners brought some of the big flightless birds to [the state]523-the state with the ambition to replace beef as a cash crop . [They]651-some fanners must have been [slick talkers]653-slick talkers , because [they]651-some fanners convinced just about [everybody]654-everybody that [the public]655-the public would soon be clamoring for emu oil , leather , and meat . So emu [producers]656-producers raised birds to sell to [other people]657-other people to raise birds , and at one point [a breeding pair]658-a breeding pair cost about thirty - five thousand dollars .

As best [I]0-i could make out , [Flip]131-flip 's emu encounter happened on [one of those narrow country roads in [the middle of nowhere]665-the middle of nowhere]664-one of those narrow country roads in the middle of nowhere , while [he]131-flip was driving back from a dove lease [someone]2928-someone had let [him]131-flip in on . Dove season lasts from the beginning of September to [the end of October]667-the end of october . If [you]668-you do n't have [your]668-you own acreage , [you]668-you can pay someone else for the privilege of hunting [[their]2928-someone land]669-their land . The best leases are covered with sunflowers or corn and feature a water tank , which brings the doves in fast and low , wings flashing .

[Flip]131-flip 's share of the lease had been seventy - five dollars , which [Mama]2932-mama had paid just to get [him]131-flip out of [the trailer]429-the trailer for a few days . [We]671-we hoped [Flip]131-flip might be lucky enough to hit some doves [we]671-we could grill with some bacon and jalapenos . [He]131-flip honked the horn and shouted at the creature to move away , but the emu would n't budge . It just stood there looking at [him]131-flip with beady yellow eyes . CHAPTER 4

After five minutes of shooting practice , [I]0-i was streaked with sweat and dust . Plumes of powdered fire rose from the paved ground with each impact of the basketball .

No dirt on earth sticks to [you]753-you like [East Texas]21-east texas red clay . The wind blows it over [you]753-you and it tastes sweet in [your]753-you mouth . CHAPTER 5

CHAPTER 6

[Mama]2932-mama was about a week overdue when [she]2932-mama finally went into labor in late May .

Springtime in [Southeast Texas]27-southeast texas is a mean season . There are some pretty sights , the dazzling fields of bluebonnets , the flowering of Mexican buckeyes and redbuds , the greening of [dry meadows]852-dry meadows . But spring is also a time when fire ants begin to mound after lying idle all winter , and the gulf whips up storms that spit out hail and lightning and twisters . [Our]853-our region was scored by tornadoes that would double back in surprise attacks , jigsawing across [rivers]854-rivers and down [main streets]855-main streets , and other places tornadoes were n't supposed to go . [We]853-our got white tornadoes too . a deadly rotating froth that occurred in sunlight well after [people]397-people thought the storm was over .

Tornadoes were always a threat to [Bluebonnet Ranch]18-bluebonnet ranch because of a law of nature that says tornadoes are irresistibly attracted to [trailer parks]857-trailer parks . [Scientists]858-scientists say it 's a myth , tornadoes are no more drawn to [trailer parks]857-trailer parks than anywhere else . But [you]859-you could n't fool [the residents

of Welcome]860-the residents of welcome . Whenever [a twister]861-a twister appeared in or around [town]2940-town , it headed either to [Bluebonnet Ranch]18-bluebonnet ranch or [another Welcome subdivision]863-another welcome subdivision called [Happy Hills]750-happy hills . How [Happy Hills]750-happy hills got its name was a mystery , because [the landscape]750-happy hills was as flat as a tortilla and barely two feet over sea level .

Anyway , [Happy Hills]750-happy hills was [a neighborhood of [new two - story residences]864-new two - story residences referred to as " big hair houses "[750-happy hills] by [everyone else in Welcome who had to make do with [one - level ranch dwellings]866-one - level ranch dwellings]865-everyone else in welcome who had to make do with one - level ranch dwellings]750-happy hills . [The subdivision]750-happy hills had undergone just as many tornado strikes as [Bluebonnet Ranch]18-bluebonnet ranch , which [some people]867-some people cited as an example of how tornadoes would just as likely strike [a wealthy neighborhood]392-the trailer park as [a trailer park]392-the trailer park .

But [one Happy Hills resident]869-one happy hills resident , [Mr. Clem Cottle]178-mr. clem cottle , was so alarmed by a white tornado that cut right across [[his]178-mr. clem cottle front yard]870-his front yard that [he]178-mr. clem cottle did some research on [the property]871-the property and discovered a dirty secret : [Happy Hills]750-happy hills had been built on the remains of [an old trailer park]392-the trailer park . It was a rotten trick in [Clem]178-mr. clem cottle 's opinion , because [he]178-mr. clem cottle would never have knowingly bought [a house in [a place where [a trailer park]392-the trailer park once stood]873-a place where a trailer park once stood]872-a house in a place where a trailer park once stood . It was an invitation to disaster . It was just as bad as building on [an Indian graveyard]874-an indian graveyard .

[[Stuck]179-stuck with [residences]876-residences that had been exposed as tornado magnets , [the homeowners of [Happy Hills]750-happy hills]875-stuck with residences that had been exposed as tornado magnets , the homeowners of happy hills]875-stuck with residences that had been exposed as tornado magnets , the homeowners of happy hills made the best of the situation by pooling [their]875-stuck with residences that had been exposed as tornado magnets , the homeowners of happy hills resources to build [a communal storm shelter]877-a communal storm shelter . It was [a concrete room that had been half - sunk in the ground and banked with soil on all sides]878-a concrete room that had been half - sunk in the ground and banked with soil on all sides , with the result that there was finally [a hill in [Happy Hills]750-happy hills]879-a hill in happy hills .

[Bluebonnet Ranch]18-bluebonnet ranch , however , did n't have anything remotely resembling a storm shelter .

If a tornado cut through [the trailer park]392-the trailer park , [we]880-we were [all goners]881-all goners . The knowledge gave [us]880-we a more or less fatalistic attitude about natural disasters . As with so many other aspects of [our]880-we lives , [we]880-we were never prepared for trouble .

[We]880-we just tried like hell to get out of the way when it came .

[Mama]2932-mama 's pains had started in the middle of the night . At about three in the morning . [I]0-i realized [she]2932-mama was up and moving around , and [I]0-i got up with [her]2932-mama . [I]0-i 'd found it nearly impossible to sleep anyway , because it was raining . Until [we]880-we 'd moved to [Bluebonnet Ranch]18-bluebonnet ranch , [I]0-i 'd always thought rain was a soothing sound , but when it rains on the tin roof of a single - wide , the noise rivals the decibel level of [an airplane hangar]882-an airplane hangar .

[I]0-i used the oven timer to measure [Mama]2932-mama 's contractions , and when [they]883-they were eight minutes apart , [we]880-we called the ob - gyn . Then [I]0-i called [Miss Marva]121-miss marva to come take [us]880-we to [the family clinic]884-the family clinic , [a local outreach of [a Houston hospital]885-a houston hospital]884-the family clinic .

[I]0-i had just gotten [my]0-i license , and although [I]0-i thought [I]0-i was [a pretty good driver]886-a pretty good driver , [Mama]2932-mama had said [she]2932-mama would feel more comfortable if [Miss Marva]121-miss marva drove [us]880-we . Privately [I]0-i thought [we]880-we would have been a lot safer with [me]0-i behind the wheel , since [Miss Marva]121-miss marva 's driving technique was at best creative , and at worst [she]121-miss marva was an accident waiting to happen . " Thank God . "[0-i] [I]0-i said , instantly relieved . [[Hardy]3004-hardy 's pickup]533-the pickup would plow through anything .

[I]0-i waited at the door and watched through the crack . The hail had stopped falling but the rain held steady , sometimes coming in cold sideways sheets through the narrow opening of the door . [I]0-i heard [her]2932-mama breathe [[my]0-i father]373-churchill 's name softly . A needle of pain went through the back of [my]0-i throat . [[My]0-i father]373-churchill 's name , when [she]2932-mama was giving birth to [[another man]384-another man 's child]902-another man 's child .

[The Cateses ' blue truck]906-the cateses ' blue truck stopped in front , and [Hardy]3004-hardy strode to the door . [He]373-churchill was wearing a fleece - lined windbreaker with the school panther logo on the back . "[373-churchill]

[Mama]2932-mama shook [her]2932-mama head . As pregnant as [she]2932-mama was , there was no way [her]2932-mama old raincoat was going to fit . The flooding had already turned Welcome into [a chain of little islands]914-a chain of little islands . The trick of going from one place to another was to know the roads well enough that [you]915-you could judge which [flowing streams]916-flowing streams were passable . All it takes is two feet of water to float virtually [any car]917-any car . [Hardy]3004-hardy was [a master at negotiating Welcome]3004-hardy , taking a circuitous route to avoid low ground . [He]3004-hardy followed [farm roads]918-farm roads , cut through [parking lots]919-parking lots , and guided [the pickup]533-the pickup through currents until fountains of water spewed from the trenching tires .

[I]0-i was amazed by [Hardy]3004-hardy 's presence of mind , the lack of visible tension , the way [he]3004-hardy made small talk with [Mama]2932-mama to distract [her]2932-mama . The only sign of effort was the notch between [his]3004-hardy brows . There is nothing a Texan loves more than to pit [himself]3004-hardy against the elements . [Texans]171-texans take a kind of ornery pride in [the state]523-the state 's raucous weather . Epic storms , killing heat , winds that threaten to strip a layer of skin off , the endless variety of twisters and hurricanes . No matter how bad the weather gets , or what level of hardship is imposed , [Texans]171-texans receive it with variations on a single question ... "Hot enough for you1?"[171-texans] ... "Wet enough for [you]3004-hardy ? "[171-texans] ... " Dry enough for [you]3004-hardy ? "[171-texans] ... and so forth .

CHAPTER 7

During the first six weeks of [Carrington]1038-carrington 's life , [we]961-we developed habits that later proved impossible to break . [Some]962-some would last a lifetime .

[Mama]2932-mama was slow to heal , both spiritually and physically . [The baby]3035-the baby 's birth had depleted [her]2932-mama in ways [I]0-i did n't understand . [She]2932-mama still laughed and smiled , still hugged [me]0-i and asked how [my]0-i day at [school]424-school was . [Her]2932-mama weight receded until [she]2932-mama looked almost the same as [she]2932-mama had before . But something was wrong . [I]0-i could n't put [my]0-i finger on it ; it was a subtle erasure of something that had been there before .

[Miss Marva]121-miss marva said it was just that [Mama]2932-mama was tired . When [you]121-miss marva were pregnant , [your]121-miss marva body went through nine months of change , and it took at least that long to get back to normal . The main thing , [she]121-miss marva said , was to give [Mama]2932-mama lots of understanding and help .

[I]0-i wanted to help , not just for [Mama]2932-mama 's sake , but because [I]0-i loved [Carrington]1038-carrington so passionately . [I]0-i loved everything about [her]2932-mama , the silky baby skin and platinum curls , the way [she]2932-mama splashed in the bath like [a baby mermaid]964-a baby mermaid . [Her]2932-mama eyes had turned the exact blue - green shade of Aquafresh toothpaste . [Her]2932-mama gaze followed [me]0-i everywhere , [her]2932-mama mind filled with thoughts [she]2932-mama could n't yet express .

[[My]0-i friends]965-my friends and [my]0-i social life did n't interest [me]0-i nearly as much as [the baby]3035-the baby . [I]0-i pushed [Carrington]1038-carrington in [her]2932-mama stroller , fed and played with [her]2932-mama , and put [her]2932-mama down for naps . That was n't always easy . [Carrington]1038-carrington was [a fussy baby]3035-the baby , just shy of being colicky .

[The pediatrician]967-the pediatrician had said that for an official diagnosis of colic , [the baby]3035-the baby had to cry three hours a day . [Carrington]1038-carrington cried about two hours and fifty - five minutes , and the rest of the day [she]2932-mama fretted . The pharmacist mixed up a batch of something [he]967-the pediatrician called " gripe water , "[967-the pediatrician] a milky - looking liquid that smelled like licorice . Giving [Carrington]1038-carrington a few drops before and after [her]2932-mama bottle seemed to help a little .

Since [her]2932-mama crib was in [[my]0-i room]2906-my room , [I]0-i usually heard [her]2932-mama first at night and [I]0-i ended up being the one to comfort [her]2932-mama . [Carrington]1038-carrington woke three or four times a night . [I]0-i soon learned to fix [her]2932-mama bottles and line them up in the refrigerator before [I]0-i went to bed . [I]0-i began to sleep lightly , one ear pressed to the pillow , the other waiting for a signal from [Carrington]1038-carrington . As soon as [I]0-i heard [her]2932-mama snuffling and grunting . [I]0-i leaped out of bed , ran to warm a bottle in the microwave , and rushed back . It was best to catch [her]2932-mama early . Once [she]2932-mama started crying in earnest , it took a while to settle [her]2932-mama down .

[I]0-i would sit back in the slider rocker , tilting the bottle to keep [Carrington]1038-carrington from sucking down air . while [her]2932-mama little fingers patted [mine]0-i . [I]0-i was so tired [I]0-i was nearly delirious , and [the baby]3035-the baby was too . both of [us]970-us intent on getting formula into [her]2932-mama tummy quickly so [we]970-us could go back to sleep . After [she]2932-mama had taken about four ounces [I]0-i sat [her]2932-mama up in [my]0-i lap , [her]2932-mama body folded over [my]0-i supporting hand like a beanbag toy . As soon as [she]2932-mama burped , [I]0-i put [her]2932-mama back in the crib and crawled into bed like a wounded animal . [I]0-i had never suspected [I]0-i could reach a level of exhaustion that actually hurt , or that sleep could become so precious [I]0-i 'd have sold [my]0-i soul for another hour .

Not surprisingly , after school started , [my]0-i grades were not impressive . [I]0-i was still okay in the subjects that had always been easy for [me]0-i , English and history and social science . But math was impossible . Every day [I]0-i slipped farther behind . Each gap in [my]0-i understanding made the next lessons that much more difficult , until [I]0-i went to math class with a sick stomach and the pulse rate of a Chihuahua . A big mid - semester test was the make - or - break point at which [I]0-i would get such a bad grade that [I]0-i would be doomed to fail the rest of the semester .

The day before the test , [I]0-i was a wreck . [My]0-i anxiety spread to [Carrington]1038-carrington , who cried when [I]0-i held [her]2932-mama and screamed when [I]0-i put [her]2932-mama down . It happened to be a day when [[Mama]2932-mama 's friends]971-mama 's friends from work had invited [her]2932-mama out to dinner , which meant [she]2932-mama would n't be [home]2899-home until eight or nine . Although [I]0-i had planned to ask [Miss Marva]121-miss marva if [she]121-miss marva would look after [Carrington]1038-carrington an extra couple of hours , [she]121-miss marva had greeted [me]0-i at the door with an ice bag clasped to [her]121-miss marva head . [She]121-miss marva had a migraine , [she]121-miss marva said , and as soon as [I]0-i took [the baby]3035-the baby [she]121-miss marva was going to take some medicine and go to bed .

There was no way to save [myself]0-i . Even if [I]0-i 'd had time to study , it would n't have made a difference . Filled with hopelessness and unendurable frustration . [I]0-i held [Carrington]1038-carrington against [my]0-i chest while [she]121-miss marva screeched in [my]0-i ear . [I]0-i wanted to make [her]121-miss marva stop . " Stop crying now . "[0-i] The rage in [my]0-i voice caused [Carrington]1038-carrington to scream until [she]121-miss marva choked . [I]0-i was certain [anyone outside the trailer]974-anyone outside the trailer could hear and would assume [someone]2928-someone was being murdered .

"[2932-mama] [I]0-i went to [[my]0-i room]2906-my room with swift strides and closed the door in a cowardly half - slam , when [I]0-i should have had the guts to do it full - out . But at least [I]0-i had the mean , fleeting satisfaction of hearing [the baby]3035-the baby cry .

CHAPTER 8

As the year went on [I]0-i had begun to measure the passage of time not by the signposts of [my]0-i own development , but by [Carrington]1038-carrington 's . The first time [she]2932-mama rolled over , the first time [she]2932-mama sat on [her]2932-mama own , ate applesauce mixed with powdered rice , the first haircut , the first tooth . [I]0-i was the one [she]2932-mama always raised [her]2932-mama arms to first , giving [me]0-i a wet gummy grin . It amused and disconcerted [Mama]2932-mama at first , and then it became something [everyone]2944-everyone accepted matter - of - factly .

The bond between [Carrington]1038-carrington and [me]0-i was closer than that of [sisters]2918-sisters ; it was more like that of [parent]1024-parent and [child]2997-child . Not as a result of intention or choice ... it simply was . It seemed natural that [I]0-i would go with [Mama]2932-mama and [the baby]3035-the baby to [[her]2932-mama pediatrician]1026-her pediatrician 's visits . [Families]1123-families went there to picnic in the daytime . Now the gazebo was empty and dark . Just before [we]1124-we had left the party , [I]0-i had chugged the rest of [Luke]123-luke 's tequila sunrise . [My]0-i head was spinning , and [I]0-i reeled between waves of giddiness and nausea . CHAPTER 10

The sight of [a sullen teenager]1257-a sullen teenager is common no matter where [you]1258-you go . [Texas men]1279-texas men are more territorial than most . One time [I]0-i went into [the bedroom]982-the bedroom to change , and just before [I]0-i pulled [my]0-i shirt off [I]0-i saw [him]119-louis staring at [me]0-i through the window in back that faced [[the neighboring fanner]1335-the neighboring fanner 's field]1336-the neighboring fanner 's field .

[My]0-i mind shot to the last moment [I]0-i had seen [Mama]2932-mama that night . [I]0-i had been quiet but irritable , watching [her]2932-mama walk to the door in jeans and high heels . [The police]1341-the police said the accident happened on [the east freeway]1353-the freeway — this was back before [I-10]1354-i-10 was finished — where [eighteen - wheelers]1355-eighteen - wheelers went as fast as [they]1355-eighteen - wheelers wanted . [Mama]2932-mama was killed on impact .

CHAPTER 11

[Mama]2932-mama had no life insurance and hardly any savings . which had at least thirty of [them]1395-we set up in rows . [I]0-i had n't realized there would be so many choices . [Poor people]1402-poor people have few choices in life , and most of the time [you]1403-you do n't think much about it . Do not stand at [my]0-i grave and weep

[I]0-i am not there , [I]0-i do not sleep .

[I]0-i am a thousand winds that blow ,

[I]0-i am the diamond glints on snow ,

[I]0-i am the gentle autumn rain .

When [you]1443-you awaken in the morning 's hush

[I]0-i am the swift uplifting rush

[I]0-i am the soft stars that shine at night .

Do not stand at [my]0-i grave and cry ,

[I]0-i am not there ; [I]0-i did not die .

It may not have been a religious poem , but by the time [Deb]224-deb had finished , there were tears in many eyes .

[Houston]2907-houston is a long - legged city laid out akimbo like [a wicked woman]1615-a wicked woman after a night of sin . Big problems and big pleasures — that 's [Houston]2907-houston . But in a state of generally friendly people . [Houstonians]52-houstonians are the nicest , as long as [you]1616-you do n't mess with [[their]52-houstonians property]1617-their property . [They]52-houstonians have a high regard for [property]1618-property , that is to say land , and [they]52-houstonians have a particular understanding of it .

As the only major [American city]53-american city with no zoning code to speak of . [Houston]2907-houston is an ongoing experiment in the influence of free market forces on land use . [You]1619-you 're likely to see [strip clubs and triple - X stores]1620-strip clubs and triple - x stores cozying up to [circumspect office buildings]1621-circumspect office buildings and [condos]1622-condos , and shade - tree mechanics and [shotgun houses]1623-shotgun houses sidled against [concrete plazas studded with glass skyscrapers]1624-concrete plazas studded with glass skyscrapers . That 's because [Houstonians]52-houstonians have always preferred real ownership of [[their]52-houstonians land]669-their land over letting [the government]1626-the government have control over how things ought to be arranged . [They]52-houstonians 'll gladly pay the price for that freedom , even if it results in undesirable businesses springing up like mesquite trees .

In [Houston]2907-houston , new money is just as good as old . No matter who [you]1627-you are or where [you]1627-you came from , [you]1627-you 're welcome to the dance as long as [you]1628-you can afford the ticket . CHAPTER 14

Being blond , in particular , was a serious investment of time and money , and [Salon One]1670-salon one gave [women]776-women the best color of [their]776-women lives . [Zenko]252-zenko was [a small man with a powerful presence and the electric grace of [a dancer]1741-a dancer]252-zenko . [A waiter]1864-the waiter was enlisted to answer questions about the menu . The word " emu "[0-i] set [me]0-i off .

[I]0-i felt a laugh break from [my]0-i lips , and then another , and then there was no stopping the helpless giggles that made [my]0-i eyes water and [my]0-i shoulders tremble . [The waiter]1864-the waiter tactfully disappeared . Then there was the bug project . [Carrington]1038-carrington had decided on a lightning bug . [I]0-i took [Carrington]1038-carrington to [Hobby Lobby]87-hobby lobby , where [we]2364-we spent forty dollars on paint , [Styrofoam]321-styrofoam . plaster of [Paris]76-paris , and pipe cleaners . [We]2364-we made the body of the bug and covered it with wet plaster strips , and painted it black , red , and yellow when it was dry . [The entire kitchen]554-the kitchen had been turned into a disaster zone in the process . " Oh . "[0-i] Nonplussed , [I]0-i sat at the table . [I]0-i always appreciated help whenever it was given . CHAPTER 19

[Churchill]373-churchill told [me]0-i about strategic inflection points while [we]2377-we wrote the " Why Paranoia Is Good , "[373-churchill] chapter of [his]373-churchill book . A strategic inflection point , [he]373-churchill explained , is a huge turning point in the life of [a company]2378-a company , a technological advancement or opportunity that changes the way everything is done . Like the breakup of [Bell]322-bell in 1984 , or when [Apple]323-apple came out with the iPod . It can boost a business into the stratosphere or sink it beyond any hope of recovery ' . But no matter what the results are , the rules of the game are changed forever .

The strategic inflection point in [my]0-i relationship with [Gage]271-gage happened the weekend after [Carrington]1038-carrington had turned in the lightning bug project . It was late Sunday morning , and [Carrington]1038-carrington had gone outside to play while [I]0-i took a long shower . It was a cold day with hard stinging gusts . [The flatlands]2379-the flatlands near [Houston]2907-houston offered no obstructions , not even a few lonely mesquite trees to hook the hem of the sky . and the long open fetch gave the wind plenty of [room]2380-room to collect momentum .

[I]0-i dressed in a long - sleeved tee and jeans , and a heavy wool cardigan with a hood . Although [I]0-i usually flat - ironed [my]0-i hair to make it shiny and straight . [I]0-i did n't bother that day . letting it curl crazily over [my]0-i shoulders and back .

[I]0-i crossed through [the visiting room]2381-the visiting room with [its]2381-the visiting room towering ceilings , where [Gretchen]2920-gretchen was busy directing [a team of professional Christmas decorators]2382-a team of professional christmas decorators . Angels was the theme [she]2920-gretchen had picked that year , obliging the decorators to perch on high ladders to hang cherubs and seraphim and swags of gold cloth . Christmas music played in the background , [Dean Martin]324-dean martin singing " [Baby]153-baby , It 's Cold Outside "[324-dean martin] with finger - snapping panache .

[My]0-i feet bounced to the music as [I]0-i went outside to the back . [I]0-i heard [Churchill]373-churchill 's scuffly laugh , and [Carrington]1038-carrington squealing in glee . Pulling [my]0-i hood up , [I]0-i wandered toward the sounds .

[[Churchill]373-churchill 's wheelchair]2163-churchill 's wheelchair was at the corner of [the patio]3282-the garden , facing an incline at [the north side of [the garden]3282-the garden]2385-the north side of the garden . [I]0-i stopped short as [I]0-i saw [[my]0-i sister]2920-gretchen standing at the end of [a zip line]2387-a zip line , a cable that had been mounted on the incline and hung with a pulley that slid from the higher end to the lower one .

[Gage]271-gage , dressed in jeans and an ancient blue sweatshirt , was tightening the end of the line while [Carrington]1038-carrington urged [him]271-gage to hurry . " Hold [your]271-gage horses , "[271-gage] [he]271-gage told [her]2920-gretchen , grinning at [her]2920-gretchen impatience . " Let [me]271-gage make sure the line will hold [you]271-gage . "[271-gage]

" [I]2920-gretchen 'm doing it now , "[2920-gretchen] [she]2920-gretchen said in determination , grasping the pulley handle .

" [I]271-gage ca n't wait ! "[271-gage]

" Wait ! "[2920-gretchen]

[He]271-gage caught [her]2920-gretchen easily , plucking [her]2920-gretchen from the pulley and swinging [her]2920-gretchen to the ground . [The two of [them]1427-the two of them]1427-the two of them laughed , whooped , neither noticing [my]0-i approach .

" [I]0-i told [you]373-churchill to wait , "[0-i] [I]0-i shouted at [Carrington]1038-carrington , dizzy with relief and rage , the remnants of fear still rattling in [my]0-i throat . [She]2920-gretchen fell silent and blanched , staring at [me]0-i with round blue eyes .

" [I]2920-gretchen did n't hear [you]373-churchill . "[2920-gretchen] [she]2920-gretchen said . It was a lie , and [we]1427-the two of them both knew it . [you]0-i — "[0-i] [I]0-i raised [my]0-i hands in a defensive gesture , wrists stiff . [I]0-i looked at the two of [them]2391-them standing together , and [I]0-i heard [Churchill]373-churchill call [my]0-i name .

[Me]0-i against [the three of [them]2391-them]2110-the three of them .

[I]0-i turned away abruptly , hardly able to see through the bitter slick of tears . Time to retreat . [I]0-i walked with fast , digging strides . As [I]0-i passed [the man in the wheelchair]2393-the man in the wheelchair , [I]0-i growled , " [You]2393-the man in the wheelchair 're in trouble too , [Churchill]373-churchill , "[0-i] without breaking pace .

By the time [I]0-i reached the warm sanctuary of [the kitchen]554-the kitchen , [I]0-i was cold to the bone . CHAPTER 23

[I]0-i knew a little about [Gage]271-gage 's private views on the subject . CHAPTER 24

[I]0-i drove away from [[Hardy]3004-hardy 's apartment building]2764-hardy 's apartment building , intending to go straight to [River Oaks]65-river oaks and confront [Churchill]373-churchill . If [Churchill]373-churchill was [[Carrington]1038-carrington 's father]3681-carrington 's father ... [My]0-i finger was shaking as [I]0-i pressed the button for the eighteenth floor , a little from fear but mostly from anger . [I]0-i did n't like getting angry , [I]0-i hated the bitter adrenaline rush that came with it . But at the moment [I]0-i was ready to explode . [I]0-i wanted to throw things .

[I]0-i went to [Gage]271-gage 's door with long , heel - digging strides , and hammered with a force that bruised [my]0-i knuckles . When there was no response , [I]0-i raised [my]0-i fist to hammer again , and nearly pitched forward as the door was opened .
